channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2023110956
item.description:
Report X-2023110956

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package was found on trailer # 453540 already wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 2 x 2.5 gallons plastic bottles of convo clean forte 1 x 2.5 plastic bottle of convo clean forte had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release from container. package had no slotted partitions, bags, or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous material followed contents contained and awaiting deposition. DescribePack: 1 x 2.5 gallons plastic bottle of convo clean forte had a loose cap allowing .25 gallon to release from bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023110989
item.description:
Report X-2023110989

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: NEWVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to load one, we saw a couple drops on the floor surround the drum, we put it in a hazmat tote and took it to the cage for processing DescribePack: there is a dent right below the brim of the drum and one on the lip of the drum, it also must have been underneath heavier items because if you tilt it the seal on the pour spout is bad and it leaks out of there as well, but upright it doesn't leak but a few drops if its slightly moved. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put in a bin upright and put in the hazmat cage under the hood.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment was taken out of system flow due to 5- gallon metal pail / drum wet and leaking package found on trailer # 538459 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection 1 x 5 gallons metal pail / drum of ethanol 190 P had crack on the bottom of the container allowing all 5 gallons to release from container. no outer package was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous material followed contents contained and awaiting deposition. DescribePack: 1 5 gallon metal pail / drum had crack on the bottom of the container allowing all 5 gallons of to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pail/ drum was placed in a hazmat lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023110551
item.description:
Report X-2023110551

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It appears that sometime during transport this package was dropped. 4 out of 6 tin cans have slightly crushed bottoms. This damage to the body of the Tin Cans led to one of the cans leaking. One tin can is completely empty and there are visual signs of dried liquid marks. The outer fiberboard box absorbed all liquid and dried. Outer box is not wet. Flammable liquid dried or evaporated. DescribePack: No visible hole, but can is crimped on the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic lined HazMat tub and moved to HazMat vented table. Awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023110538
item.description:
Report X-2023110538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found in Unload. Box was wet on the bottom when retrieved. Upon further inspection, a bottle of Alcohol Solution had a loose cap and leaked inside of box. Placed damaged box in a QA bin and placed box in Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Box must have flipped over in transportation. Checked Caps of all bottles to see if they were secured tightly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Secured package inside of a QA bin to prevent liquids from leaking on the floor or other packages.

X-2023110493 SequenceEvent: Bottle leaked from top cap due to overturned pallet DescribePack: top cap leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: box removed from area for inspection and procesing. 2. X-2023110494 SequenceEvent: Box crushed by overturned pallet on pickup trailer DescribePack: Plastic bottles leaked from threaded caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Affected packages removed from area for processing. Incidental spillage absorbed by packaging

item.title: Report E-2023110501
item.description:
Report E-2023110501

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: YORK
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLI TRANSPORT, LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was on store lot unloading compartment number 4 of our DOT tank trailer. Driver did not latch the fittings to the drop tube correctly. When the material started to flow it 'jumped' like normal and the hose disconnected from the drop tube resulting in a spill of diesel fuel of around 170 gallons. The driver stopped the flow of product and contacted the local fire department. York local fire department personnel, in house clean up, and 3rd party clean up teams all responded to the scene. We also filed a report with the Pennsylvania Dept. of Environmental Protection.

item.title: Report X-2023110491
item.description:
Report X-2023110491

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed on side, not following the direction arrows and the weight of first can was on second can and this led the lid to pop. Popped lid led to internal leakage. DescribePack: Top of can, lid popped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in HazMat tub and taken to HazMat secure area.
